thread.title: Poland’s Controversial Holocaust Bill Becomes Law

author: Drew Hinshaw
title: Poland’s Controversial Holocaust Bill Becomes Law
text:
WARSAW—Polish President Andrzej Duda approved a libel law imposing up to three years in jail for accusing the Polish people of assisting in the Holocaust, overriding the objections of the Auschwitz memorial council, the Israeli government, the U.S. State Department and some Holocaust survivors, all of whom expressed worry it would gag a discussion over how 6 million Jews were murdered during World War II.
Standing before five Polish flags, Mr. Duda told reporters he would sign a bill mandating fines or imprisonment for Poles... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
